Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text: 25 ll. on recto, verso pasted down; written by same scribe and in same hand as P BM EA 10483. Dated year 2 Thoth 26 of Ptol. Soter II. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Loan of corn by two brothers, Panobchunis & Hor, sons of Psenesis to the veteran Gay son of Pates. Below names of four witnesses, all different from those in no.10483, though in all other respects the two documents, so far as extant, agree. Scribe. Nechtmin son of Nechtmin. [...] (For the borrower Kaies Patetos cf. P. Grenf. I no. 23)".
Curator's comments: Kaplony-Heckel, U., Das Getreide-Darlehn P. Haun. Inv. Demot. 2, in K. Ryholt (ed.), Acts of the seventh international conference of Demotic studies. Copenhagen, 2002, 243.Text 11 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (C J Martin/S.E. Thomas). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (307) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/307)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: brittle, fractured, loss Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: leather (damaged) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
